list_page_teaser: Dr. McCoy's warm image stands in stark contrast to Mr. Spock's logical image, because their personalities are so different.  Compare their images, and see how Captain Kirk and the rest of the crew fit in the mix.
description_html:
Archetypal characters like Dr. McCoy, Captain Kirk, and Mr. Spock help give Star Trek a lasting appeal. Evidence of this appeal lies in the fact that the three seasons in Star Trek: The Original Series led to the creation of over a dozen films and several additional television series!

Today, Star Trek has an Official Star Trek Fan Club and its own Official Fan Club Wiki. The show is on Facebook and Twitter, and there's actually a whole list of fan sites with the latest news about the original series and its many spinoffs.

These images offer insight into the characters from The Original Series that cannot be found any place else. For more of this type of insight, see the stories about Captain Kirk and Dr. McCoy and Mr. Spock on ArtsyVisions.com.
story_html:
Note: these images are based on the characters as they appear in Star Trek: The Original Series only. In particular, they do not take into account any of the other series, movies, or books.

Additionally, the profiles that form the basis of the images do not consider or any of the times the mind of a character is under control of aliens — as in the episodes The Cage and Plato's Stepchildren — or they are liberated from their normal inhibitions — as in the episodes The Naked Time and Amok Time.
affiliate_ad_future_html:
Starfleet Access!

image_list.title: Mr. Spock
image_list.subtitle_html: First Officer of the USS Enterprise
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Mr. Spock's spiritual portrait shows he is extremely logical and realistic. It looks so different from Dr. McCoy's because their personalities are so different.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Yellow in Spock's spiritual portrait represents his preference for being practical and realistic.  In Introverts, the dominant function is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long horizontal line to represent this.  His realism is evident in the way he is gives precedence to data and facts over ideas and  theories.
image_list.explain_aux: The Green in Spock's spiritual portrait represents his strong tendency to make rational decisions.  In Introverts, the auxiliary function is directed outwardly and is more evident than the dominant function.  Spock's Vulcan heritage made him extremely logical.  He is insulted when confronted for displaying any emotion whatsoever, and he thinks their feelings make humans vulnerable and flawed.
image_list.disclosure_html: This story contains some affiliate marketing links. Making a purchase after clicking on one of these helps support this site.

image_list.title: James T. Kirk
image_list.subtitle_html: Captain of the USS Enterprise
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Captain Kirk's spiritual portrait is full of Green and Red, showing he is decisive and rational, but can let his heart rule his head when the situation calls for it.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Green in Kirk's spiritual portrait represents his tendency to make logical rational decisions.  In Extraverts, the dominant function is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this.  Kirk demonstrates his ability to remain calm and make objective decisions whenever he battles alien creatures.
image_list.explain_aux: The Yellow in Kirk's spiritual portrait represents his realism.  In Extraverts, the auxiliary function is directed inwardly and is less evident than the dominant function.  His realism is evident in his willingness to bend and occasionally even break Starfleet regulations in situations that warrant it.
image_list.disclosure_html: This story contains some affiliate marketing links. Making a purchase after clicking on one of these helps support SeeOurMinds.com!
image_list.story_intro_html: The main characters of Star Trek: The Original Series — Captain Kirk, Mr. Spock, and Dr. McCoy — were ....

image_list.title: Dr. Leonard H. 'Bones' McCoy
image_list.subtitle_html: Chief Medical Officer of the USS Enterprise
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Dr. McCoy's spiritual portrait shows he is realistic and compassionate.  It looks so different from Mr. Spock's because their personalities are so different.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Yellow in Dr. McCoy's spiritual portrait represents his realism.  In Extraverts, the dominant function is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this.  McCoy rarely discusses theories or other ideas, showing a distinct preference for being pragmatic and down-to-earth.
image_list.explain_aux: The Red in Dr. McCoy's spiritual portrait represents his strong emotions.  In Extraverts, the auxiliary function is directed inwardly and is less evident than the dominant function.  McCoy demonstrates his compassion for others in the way he rarely takes up arms or fights anyone in any way.  Also, he is well-known for frequently criticizing Mr. Spock for his dispassionate and obsessive focus on logic.
image_list.disclosure_html: This story contains some affiliate marketing links. Clicking on one of these and making a purchase helps support SeeOurMinds.com.
image_list.story_intro_html: The main characters of Star Trek — Dr. McCoy, Captain Kirk, and Mr. Spock — were among ....

image_list.title: Montgomery 'Scotty' Scott
image_list.subtitle_html: Lieutenant Commander on the USS Enterprise
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Scotty's spiritual portrait shows he is decisive and pragmatic, and his personality is similar to Captain Kirk's.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Green in Scotty's spiritual portrait represents his strong tendency to make rational decisions.  In Extraverts, the dominant function is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this.  Scotty demonstrates this trait in his willingness and ability to become an engineer and become an expert in how the starship works.
image_list.explain_aux: The Yellow in Scotty's spiritual portrait represents his realism and open to new experiences.  In Extraverts, the auxiliary function is directed inwardly and is less evident than the dominant function.  One way Scotty demonstrates this trait is by being open to risking everything to join the rest of the crew aboard the Starship.
image_list.disclosure_html: This story contains some affiliate marketing links. Clicking on one of these and making a purchase helps support this site.
image_list.story_intro_html: Scotty's image looks very much like Kirk's, and they share the ability to remain calm and decisive during times of ....

image_list.title: Uhura
image_list.subtitle_html: Lieutenant of the USS Enterprise
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Uhura's spiritual portrait shows she is realistic and compassionate, and her personality is similar to Dr. McCoy's.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Yellow in Uhura's spiritual portrait represents her dominant personality trait, her realistic outlook and open to new experiences.  In Extraverts, the dominant trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this, because it is the side of their personality that is most evident.  One way Uhura demonstrates this trait is by being open to risking everything to join the rest of the crew aboard the Starship.
image_list.explain_aux: The Red in Uhura's spiritual portrait represents their auxiliary personality trait, her warmth and compassion.  In Extraverts, the auxiliary trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a horizontal line to represent this.  She demonstrates this trait in the affection she shows for people - and the soft, cute little tribbles.

image_list.title: Sulu
image_list.subtitle_html: Lieutenant on the USS Enterprise
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Sulu's spiritual portrait shows he is realistic and logical, and his personality is similar to Chekov's.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Yellow in Sulu's spiritual portrait represents his dominant personality trait, his preference for being realistic and open to new experiences.  In Extraverts, the dominant trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this, because it is the side of their personality that is most evident.  One way Sulu demonstrates this trait is by being open to risking everything to join the rest of the crew aboard the Starship.
image_list.explain_aux: The Green in Sulu's spiritual portrait represents his preference for being calm, objective, and rational.  In Extraverts, the auxiliary trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a horizontal line to represent this.  He demonstrates this trait when he is able to remain calm and not panic when the ship is under attack.
